TPAREA Ref: MAC.06.56A.4Address: Former Warren Lodge Kingston Hill Kingston Upon Thames KT2 7HYTree category:  Details:

AIRCZ Type:: Heathrow Planning Consultation Zone: All buildings, structures, erections and works exceeding 90 metres in height (295.3 feet)Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Heathrow Airport Limited, c/o Planning Services, First Point, Buckingham Gate, Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH6 0NT

description: Variation of Condtions 2 (Garage Use), Condition 7 (Boundary Treatment), Condition 8 (PD restriction), Condition 9 (Ancillary Use Only) of Planning Permission 95/6060/FUL (Erection of two storey one bedroomed detached dwelling unit to provide accommodation ancillary to application property.)
decision_conditions: The car parking, servicing and manoeuvring areas shown on the approved plans shall be provided with a hard-bound, adequately-drained, dust-free surface prior to beneficial occupation of the development to which this permission relates and shall be permanently retained for their respective purposes and kept free from obstruction thereafter. Reason: To ensure the provision of adequate off-street parking, servicing and manoeuvering areas in the interests of the safety and operation of the highway network, in accordance with policy 6.13 of the London Plan 2016 and policies CS7 and DM9 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) (or any Order revoking and reenacting that Order with or without modification), no additions, enlargements or alterations as defined within Classes A, B or C of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to that Order shall be carried out to the building to which this permission relates unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The windows at first floor level in the north-eastern elevation in the building to which this permission relates shall be obscure glazed and fixed shut to a height of 1.7m above finished floor level and permanently retained as such thereafter.Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The facing materials used in the development to which this permission relates shall match those of the existing building unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.Reason: To safeguard the character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2016 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

All the planning conditions on planning permission Reference 95/6060/FUL remain in full force except for those explicitly amended / removed by virtue of this planning permission. Reason: For the avoidance of doubt
The applicant is informed that the submitted details, as set out above are agreed and that Condition 9 (Sustainable Drainage Scheme) is hereby fully discharged.
Condition 9 - The RBK Flood Risk Officer and RBK Environmental Health Officer have reviewed the submitted information and have no objection.

The proposed extension and alterations fall within the parameters of permitted development as set out under Schedule 2, Part 1, Classes B, C and G of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

The details submitted for Conditions 3 (Facing Materials), 12 (C02 Reductions/Internal Water Usage) and 13 (Sustainable Drainage Strategy) of Planning Permission ref: 19/01776/FUL by the applicant are considered satisfactory and these conditions are hereby fully discharged.

The Council's Design Officer is satisfied with the submitted information for Condition 4 part (iv) (PVs Panels). As such, the details submitted for Condition 4 part iv by the applicant are considered satisfactory and this condition is hereby approved.
Please provide existing first floor, loft and roof plans at a recognised scale of 1:50 or 1:100, providing a scale bar, showing the outline of entire floor plan, not just part and all key dimensions.
Please be advised that this application is for the creation of a new dwelling and therefore will need to be submitted as a Full Planning Application
The submitted CIL form has been incorrectly completed - you need to change this and advise that a new dwelling is being created

Please be advised that a fee of £462 is required for this application and a balance of £256 needs to be provided. This can be paid either online at www.kingston.gov.uk or by calling our Customer Service Team on 020 8547 5002
